meanings.sent1: I will wait till you finish your homework.
meanings.sent2: We played games till the sun went down.
meanings.sent3: Let's stay up till midnight to see the stars.
meanings.sent4: Time stood still till the clock struck twelve.
meanings.sent5: The cat waited patiently till its owner returned home.

meanings.definition: To prepare (land) for the planting of crops
meanings.sent1: Farmers till the soil before planting seeds.
meanings.sent2: They tilled the land to grow vegetables.
meanings.sent3: The gardeners decided to till the earth in the moonlight.
meanings.sent4: The tractor tilled the field swiftly and efficiently.
meanings.sent5: Tilling the garden makes it ready for sowing seeds.

meanings.definition: A cash register or drawer for money
meanings.sent1: The cashier counted the money in the till.
meanings.sent2: She placed the coins in the cash till.
meanings.sent3: The till at the store was overflowing with coins.
meanings.sent4: The till chimed as the customer paid for the items.
meanings.sent5: The till was securely locked to protect the cash inside.

meanings.definition: To work or cultivate (land) as a farmer
meanings.sent1: The farmers till the fields every spring.
meanings.sent2: They tilled the land with care and dedication.
meanings.sent3: The old farmer loved to till the soil and watch his crops grow.
meanings.sent4: Tilling the earth requires strength and patience.
meanings.sent5: The farmer's hands were calloused from tilling the land.
